title: George Ford poised to join Leicester Tigers in £450,000-a-year deal.. with Freddie Burns moving to Bath
text:
George Ford poised to join Leicester Tigers in £450,000-a-year deal.. with Freddie Burns moving to Bath George Ford is close to joining Leicester Tigers Credit: REX FEATURES 4 February 2017 • 12:00am 
E ngland fly-half George Ford is reportedly on the verge of joining Leicester Tigers on a three-year contract. 
Bath No 10 Ford has been linked with a move away from The Rec since November last year after it emerged he was upset at the way his father, Mike, was dismissed. 
Sale Sharks were thought to be the front-runners to sign the 23 year-old, but The Times is now claiming Ford has agreed a deal with the Tigers worth around £450,000 a season. George Ford had been linked with Sale Sharks Credit: REX FEATURES 
I t is believed that is far less than what he was offered by Sale, but the lure of Welford Road, where he left to join Bath in 2013, and the prospect of playing alongside England team-mate Ben Youngs at half-back, swung it in Leicester's favour. 
In a further twist, Freddie Burns could be heading in the opposite direction. Burns, it appears, is unwilling to play second fiddle to the England No 10, and is happy to move to Bath where his family is based. Freddie Burns could be moving to Bath Credit: REX FEATURES 
B ath's willingness to allow Ford to join Premiership rivals Leicester is a major turn-around. Last year, when reports of Ford's eagerness to invoke a release clause in his contract emerged, Bruce Craig - Bath's billionaire owner - insisted he would not allow his fly-half to join the Tigers. 
It is understood, though, that a suitable compensation agreement has been reached. Follow Telegraph Sport
